isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WIPER/WASHER CONTROL SWITCHES AND INDICATOR LIGHTS (HEADER MOUNTED, BEFORE JUNE 1994)

svcproc.title: WIPER/WASHER CONTROL SWITCHES AND INDICATOR LIGHTS (HEADER MOUNTED, BEFORE JUNE 1994)

svcprocinfo.para: The electric wiper/washer switches are located in the header panel before June 1994.
Refer to Figure 100 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the 6 mounting screws (Item 4) from the cab header panel (Item 7) and lower the windshield wiper/washer control panel (Item 6).

Pull the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) down to gain access to the back of the control panel. Disconnect electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2).
With the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) removed, remove the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2).
Install the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2) back into the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6).

Position the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) driver side (left) at the header panel (Item 7). Reconnect electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2).

Position the windshield wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) on the cab header panel (Item 7), making sure the connecting wires are not pinched. Secure it with the 6 mounting screws (Item 4). Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Check the wipers for correct operation.
